document: {"blocks":[{"key":"fkbu7","text":"1. Cortices from P1 rat pups of both sexes (Sprague Dawley, Charles River Laboratories, SD-001) were micro-dissected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5j1q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmim3","text":"2. Digested the cortices in papain (∼7.5 units/ml) at 33°C for 45 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af387","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s9r9","text":"3. Triturated the cortices in low and high ovomucoid solutions and resuspended in panning buffer (DPBS (GIBCO 14287) supplemented with BSA and insulin) and passed through a 20 μm mesh filter (Elko Filtering 03-20/14). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s9m2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6lc3","text":"4. Filtered cells were incubated on negative panning dishes coated with Bandeiraea Simplicifolia Lectin 1 (x2), followed by goat anti-mouse IgG+IgM (H+L) (Jackson ImmunoResearch 115-005-044), and goat anti-rat IgG+IgM (H+L) (Jackson ImmunoResearch 112-005-044) antibodies, then incubated on positive panning dishes coated with mouse anti-L1 (ASCS4, Developmental Studies Hybridoma Bank, Univ. Iowa) to bind cortical neurons. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkasf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eik4n","text":"5. Adherent cells were collected by forceful pipetting with a P1000 pipette. Isolated neurons were pelleted (11 minutes at 200 g) and resuspended in serum-free neuron growth media (NGM; Neurobasal, B27 supplement, 2 mM L-Glutamine, 100 U/ml Pen/Strep, 1 mM sodium pyruvate, 4.2 μg/ml Forskolin, 50 ng/mL BDNF, and 10 ng/mL CNTF). 70,000 neurons were plated onto 12 mm glass coverslips coated with 10 μg/ml poly-D-lysine (PDL, Sigma P6407) and 2 μg/ml laminin and incubated at 37°C in 10% CO2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":490,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfb6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csq3c","text":"6. On day in-vitro (DIV) 2, half of the media was replaced with NGM Plus (Neurobasal Plus, B27 Plus, 100 U/mL Pen/Strep, 1 mM sodium pyruvate, 4.2 μg/ml Forskolin, 50 ng/ml, BDNF, and 10 ng/ml CNTF) and AraC (10 μM) was added to stop the growth of proliferating contaminating cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ttgt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g6rf","text":"7. On DIV 3, all the media was replaced with NGM Plus. In experiments involving lentivirus infection, 100 μl of supernatant containing lentivirus plus polybrene (1 μg/ml) was added to the AraC NGM mixture on DIV 2 and completely washed out on DIV 3 and replaced with NGM Plus containing 100 ng/ml BDNF. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ued4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ms04","text":"8. Neurons were fed on DIV 6 and DIV 9 by replacing half of the media with NGM Plus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f250j","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rmsp","text":"
